page.title: 03FARMING IN ALDBOROUGH (CONT)
page.content: Sugar beet is drilled in the Spring and harvested between September and Jannary.The crop is sprayed regularly to keep down weeds so there is no need for "Singling"the beet.All the beet is taken to the Factory at Cantley for sugar production.The better drained Loam soil is good for arable Farming and the water meadows and low lying land are used for sheep and cattle.Sheep and cattle are brought for Fattening.Pigs are bred and either sold at market or to a large firm for bacon.Claire wrote that her Father's Farm has changed greatly over the last 50 years.Then 3 men worked 100 acres. it is 1 man for 400 acres.In 1985 there are many hungry people in the world but food mountains in Europe.
